result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlone D Winfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marlone D Winfield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marlone D Winfield was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per Chief Judge Directive 18-02, the Fine & Cost commitment previously entered in this case shall be converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING commencing OCTOBER 28, 2015 received and filed. (5 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to MARK TISHBERG 788 NORTH JEFFERSON STREET STE. 710 MILWAUKEE, WI 53202.
F&C Commitment issued fo failure to pay.   5 days HOC,  consecutive.  Due & owing
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) gj
JOC, Criminal Complaint, and Court Record sent to Valeria Taylor, Attorney at Law (State Public Defender Office - 819 N 6th St)

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Marlone D Winfield in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint.  Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 22 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 22 days time served.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 7/21/2015, or serve 5 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension, and court will grant.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Justice Point discharge summary report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Marlone D Winfield in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/21/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Mary D. Scholle in court, defendant Marlone D Winfield not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant picked up on a warrant.  Court sets bail.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/18/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed. aw
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Clerk contacted attorney Scholle.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 7/14/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Mary D Scholle in court earlier.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not here.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  aw

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Vince Guimont for Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Marlone D Winfield in custody.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Michelle Drott for Abbehi Medrano.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on June 17, 2014  at 8:30 am in Branch 3.
Court increases defendant's supervision with Justice Point to ENHANCED.

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel needs an offer from the state.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel has not received discovery yet, and will talk to ADA Nolten before the next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/28/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Paul Hauer for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Case sent to Branch 03, forthwith.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
-Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant ordered to attend school when in session.  No Tardiness and no unexcused absences.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marlone D Winfield in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant Marlone D Winfield in custody.  Christopher J Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
